items.title: Verifying autoprecompiles
items.description: Intended to support the verification of Powdr Labs' autoprecompiles.

items.title: AVAZAR: Automatic verification tools for zkVM arithmetization
items.description: Intended to support work on automated verification tools for zkVM arithmetizations.

items.title: ZKVM Agnostic Fuzzing
items.description: Intended to support the development of fuzzing techniques applicable to any RISC-V zkVM.

items.title: zkBugs 2.0
items.description: Intended to support an update of zkBugs.

items.title: Automated Verification of ZK Circuits
items.description: Intended to support the development of techniques to automatically verify the consistency between witness generation and constraints.

items.title: ZKarnage: Stress Testing ZK Systems Through Maximum Pain
items.description: Intended to support work on prover killers.

items.title: Plonky3 in Rocq
items.description: Intended to support an integration of Plonky3 with Rocq.

items.title: Plonky3 to Lean
items.description: Intended to support an integration of Plonky3 with Lean.

items.title: Evaluating Verus for circuits and EVM precompiles
items.description: Intended to support an evaluation of Verus as a tool to verify representative Rust code.

items.title: Better Rocq tactics for modular arithmetic & handling packed integers
items.description: Intended to support the development of Rocq tactics for handing arithmetic modulo and for handling packed integers.

items.title: cLean
items.description: Intended to support the development of cLean, a Lean DSL aimed at writing AIR circuits directly in Lean (rather than verifying pre-existing circuits extracted to Lean).

items.title: LLZK
items.description: Intended to support for the development LLZK, a family of MLIR dialects for circuits.

items.title: Lean backend for Sail
items.description: Intended to support the development of a Lean backend for Sail (adding to the existing HOL4, Isabelle, and Rocq backends) that will allow the extraction of the official RISC-V Sail specification to Lean.
items.awardedTo: University of Cambridge, Galois, Lindy Labs (first grant only)

items.title: zkLean
items.description: Intended to support an effort to develop zKLean, a Lean DSL for constraints, as well as integration of zkLean with LLZK

items.title: Certified compilation
items.description: Intended to support research aiming to establish methods for certified compilation in the Rocq ecosystem together with tools for high assurance cryptography.

items.title: Development of an EVM in Rocq
items.description: Intended to support the development of a canonical, maintainable, and validated EVM specification in Rocq that can be the basis for a verified implementation of the EVM specification for RISC-V via certified compilation.

items.title: Verification of revm and Lean backend for K
items.description: Intended to support (i) effort to verify the correctness of revm compiled to RISC-V against KEVM (a EVM specification in K); (ii) the development of a Lean backend for K that will make it possible to compare KEVM to a Lean specification of the EVM, and open up possibilities to use the K tooling for language semantics in Lean in future work.

items.title: Technical Review of Fiat-Shamir From Duplex Sponges
items.description: Intended to support a thorough technical review of the Fiat-Shamir transformation instantiated via duplex sponges

items.title: Rust Verification Through Lean 4 Tooling
items.description: Intended to support a three month investigation into Lean 4 based formal verification of Rust components used in zkEVM and zkVM stacks, focused on using the hax toolchain.

items.title: STIR & WHIR constructions in ArkLib
items.description: Intended to support the addition of executable specifications for STIR and WHIR in ArkLib.

items.title: Fiat-Shamir specification
items.description: Intended to support the development of a specification of the Fiat–Shamir transformation based on duplex sponges

items.title: Bluebell
items.description: Intended to support the implementation of the Bluebell program logic in Lean for use in ArkLib.

items.title: AI proofs in ArkLib
items.description: This grant is intended to support an experiment in using Logical Intelligence's AI tools for proofs in ArkLib.

items.title: Binius in ArkLib
items.description: Intended to support the formalization of Binius in ArkLib.

items.title: Blueprint STIR and WHIR in ArkLib
items.description: Intended to support the development of a blueprint for STIR and WHIR's security theorems in ArkLib.

items.title: Blueprint for FRI & Coding Theory prerequisites in ArkLib
items.description: Intended to support the development of a blueprint for FRI and coding theory prerequisites in ArkLib.

items.title: ArkLib
items.description: Intended to support the development of ArkLib, a library of formalized proof systems in Lean, accompanied by work on VCVio.

items.title: MLIR sidekick for Lean
items.description: Intended to support Lean-MLIR infrastructure development, including fast datastructures and a RISC-V dialect in Lean.

items.title: Lean backend for hax
items.description: Intended to support the development of a Lean backend for hax.

items.title: HACS 2026
items.description: Intended to support to HACS 2026 in March 2026.

items.title: HACS 2025
items.description: Intended to support to HACS 2025 in March 2025.

items.title: ZKProofs 7
items.description: Intended to support to ZKProofs 7 in March 2025.

items.title: ZKProofs Zurich Event
items.description: Intended to support to host a small one day event in Zurich in October 2024 to discuss the formal verification of proof systems. A summary of the event is available here.

items.title: Foundations of Probabilistic Proofs MOOC
items.description: Intended to support the development of a MOOC on the foundations of probabilistic proofs.

items.title: EthProofs
items.description: Intended to support the continued development of ethproofs.org following initial work by the Ethereum Digital Studio team.
